document.masterDocTitle: Passiflora rupestris, a new synonym of Passiflora pohlii (Passifloraceae sensu stricto)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Passiflora rupestris, a new synonym of Passiflora pohlii (Passifloraceae sensu stricto)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type :— BRAZIL . Goiás : Cavalcante ,
Pohl 2186
( holotype F! barcode V0066821F)
.

Passiflora ichthyura Mast. (1872: 587)
. Type:— BRAZIL . Goiás :
November 1839
, Gardner 3191 ( lectotype K! barcode K00036537).

Passiflora rupestris Bernacci, Mezzonato & Salimena (2014: 517)
,
syn. nov.
Type :—
BRAZIL . Minas Gerais : Rio Preto , Serra Negra , trilha para o
Ninho da Égua
,
27 January 2007
,
L. Menini Neto et al. 284
( holotype CESJ 48511!)
.

Description: —Vine moderately to densely pubescent. Stem triangular to subcylindrical, striate. Stipules 0.15–0.7 cm long, linear-triangulate/subulate to falcate. Leaves with petioles 0.9–3.7 cm long, glands absent; blades chartaceous, 2 or 3-lobed to the apex, 1.5–9.8 × 1.3–10 cm , obtriangular, divergent angle 35º–80º, apex acute, obtuse or rounded, apiculate, base acute, obtuse, rounded or subcordate, margin entire, presence of ocelli, adaxial surface glabrous to puberulous, abaxial surface densely puberulous to densely pubescent. Flowers solitary or in pairs, pedunculate; peduncles 1.2–2.5 cm long. Bracts 0.2–0.6 cm long, linear-triangulate to subulate. Flowers 2.5–3.5 cm diam.; pedicels 0.1–0.4 cm long; sepals oblong-lanceolate, 1–1.7 × 0.2–0.5 cm , apex obtuse; petals oblong-lanceolate, 0.9–1.1 × 0.2–0.4 cm , apex obtuse; corona biseriate, external filaments 0.5–1.2 cm long, filiform, apex acute, internal filaments 0.2–0.7 cm long, filiform, apex capitate; operculum plicate, 0.15–0.2 cm long, margin fimbriate; limen lobulate; androgynophore 0.5–1 cm long; filaments ca. 0.5 cm long, anthers 0.2–0.5 × 0.15–0.2 cm ; ovary 0.15–0.35 × 0.1–0.3 cm , ellipsoidal to globose, glabrous, rarely puberulous; fruits 0.7–1.7 x 0.7–1.8 cm , globose to subglobose, glabrous, rarely puberulous; styles 0.4–0.7 cm long. Fruit a berry 0.7–1.7 × 0.7–1.8 cm , globose to subglobose, glabrous. Seeds 0.25–0.4 × 0.1–0.3 cm , ellipsoidal to obovoid, testa with 6–7 transversal grooves.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Morphological characteristics of four
Passiflora , Brazilian species
of section
Decaloba DC.
most closely.

tr.td: Densely puberulous, moderately to densely pubescent
Obovate, 0.8–1.9 × 0.25–0.5 cm, apex acute to obtuse
Obovate, ca. 0.6 × 0.15 cm, apex acute to obtuse
Biseriate, external filaments 0.4–1.2 cm long, filiform, apex capitate, internal filaments 0.1–0.4 cm long, filiform, apex acute
Biseriate, external filaments ca. 1 cm long, filiform, apex acute, internal filaments ca, 0.3 cm long, filiform, apex acute
Biseriate, external filaments 0.5–1.2 cm long, filiform, apex acute, internal filaments 0.2–0.7 cm long, filiform, apex capitate
Biseriate, external filaments ca. 1.2 cm long, filiform, internal filaments 0.5–0.7 cm long, filiform, apex capitate,
0.15–0.35 × 0.1–0.3 cm, ellipsoidal to globose, glabrous, rarely puberulous

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comments: —Although
Bernacci et al. (2014)
mentioned few similarities between
P. rupestris
and
P. pohlii
, they stated the following differences: “smaller chartaceous leaves without ocelli, shorter petioles and stipules, much longer inner corona filaments, and a smooth operculum”. Except from the operculum, the other characters are not conservative, presenting wide variation within a species. As such,
P. rupestris
is recognized here as a synonym of
P. pohlii ,
as it does not have distinct diagnostic characteristics, and all of its characteristics are within the range of variation of the latter species ( Table 1 ).
